title: Screen Time and Cognitive Development
description: One-minute skill: Screen Time and Cognitive Development.

hook.text: The average teenager spends seven hours daily on screens. Researchers still debate whether that's harmful.

buildup.text: Screen time research produces conflicting resultsâ€”some studies warn of damage, others find no effect.

discovery.text: The type of screen use matters more than total hours: creative use differs vastly from passive scrolling.

twist.text: Most screen time studies are correlationalâ€”we can't prove screens cause the problems we observe.

climax.text: The strongest evidence links excessive passive consumption to reduced sleep quality and attention span.

punchline.text: It's not how long you stare at a screen. It's what you do with it.

quiz.question: What does current research suggest about screen time and learning?
options: The type of screen use matters more than total hours spent
All screen time is equally harmful to cognitive development
Screen time has been proven to have no negative effects at all
